SEARCH
Package aas_core.aas3_0.types.impl

Class AssetInformation

java.lang.Object
aas_core.aas3_0.types.impl.AssetInformation
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAssetInformation, IClass
public class AssetInformation extends Object implements IAssetInformation
In AssetInformation identifying meta data of the asset that is represented by an AAS is defined.

The asset may either represent an asset type or an asset instance.

The asset has a globally unique identifier plus – if needed – additional domain specific (proprietary) identifiers. However, to support the corner case of very first phase of lifecycle where a stabilised/constant_set global asset identifier does not already exist, the corresponding attribute getGlobalAssetId() is optional.

Constraints:

  • Constraint AASd-116: globalAssetId is a reserved key. If used as value for SpecificAssetId.getName() then SpecificAssetId.getValue() shall be identical to getGlobalAssetId().

    Constraint AASd-116 is important to enable a generic search across global and specific asset IDs.

    In the book, Constraint AASd-116 imposes a case-insensitive equality against globalAssetId. This is culturally-dependent, and depends on the system settings. For example, the case-folding for the letters "i" and "I" is different in Turkish from English.

    We implement the constraint as case-sensitive instead to allow for interoperability across different culture settings.

  • Constraint AASd-131: For AssetInformation either the getGlobalAssetId() shall be defined or at least one item in getSpecificAssetIds().

    • getGlobalAssetId

      public Optional<String> getGlobalAssetId()
      Description copied from interface: IAssetInformation
      Global identifier of the asset the AAS is representing.

      This attribute is required as soon as the AAS is exchanged via partners in the life cycle of the asset. In a first phase of the life cycle the asset might not yet have a global ID but already an internal identifier. The internal identifier would be modelled via IAssetInformation.getSpecificAssetIds().

      This is a global reference.

      Specified by:
      getGlobalAssetId in interface IAssetInformation

    • setGlobalAssetId

    • getAssetType

      public Optional<String> getAssetType()
      Description copied from interface: IAssetInformation
      In case IAssetInformation.getAssetKind() is applicable the IAssetInformation.getAssetType() is the asset ID of the type asset of the asset under consideration as identified by IAssetInformation.getGlobalAssetId().

      In case IAssetInformation.getAssetKind() is "Instance" than the IAssetInformation.getAssetType() denotes which "Type" the asset is of. But it is also possible to have an IAssetInformation.getAssetType() of an asset of kind "Type".

      Specified by:
      getAssetType in interface IAssetInformation

      Used as default.
